Articles.Content:
Random websites are advertising themselves under things, like the post new thread thing on this forum.

Can anyone tell me how to remove this?

Edited September 19, 2014 by Special Agent Sigvan
Moved to Kerbal Network (though I'm afraid I don't have a specific answer for you myself).

Have you downloaded anything recently? As in, right before this started.

You might want to check the plugins/ addons settings in your browser and see if there is anything that looks suspicious. (once something similar to what you are describing happened to me. A plugin that I did not intentionally install kept attaching advertisements to random pieces of text. It called itself something to do with free games, and when I removed it, the ads stopped.)

No, none that I remember.

Most of them have stopped, except the ones here (Which are just little lines of text, that aren't changing anything).

I think I need to pay the $$$ to get Norton Internet Security for the sake of having it.

Hell, paranoia got the best of me and I have the toolbar running now, though it doesn't seem to stop crap (Not causing the issue though, because I've had this for the entire year and had no problems).
BTW: I didn't manage to catch a screenshot, but I got one of those "ad pretending to be a Facebook notification alert" jobbies yesterday.

Might be worth installing AdBlock Plus, or something similar -- it's a browser extension, if you don't already have it. If that doesn't solve it, I'd recommend download a free copy of MalwareBytes Anti-Malware and running a scan to get rid of any malware that may have gotten onto your machine.

I'll probably get my Anti-Virus back up and running, just so I don't have to worry about this anymore.

Solution:

Adblock has a block element for such things. I blocked them and it fixed the issue.
